Data Loss Insurance: Rationale
! Unique advantages of data insurance " Service providers can actively reduce risks
# By making more copies # Any copy of data as good as original # Cost of extra copy much lower than value
" May reduce baseline replication aggressiveness # From 11 nines to 4 nines or even 2 nines
! Optional to user " Baseline service charge reduced for all
# Attract more paying customers

Premium Estimate ! Traditional formula for premium calucation
" P = L + U + E # P: premium # L: expected loss # U: underwriting expense # E: profit
! Annual data loss insurance premium " p = fbase f r v + cdisk r

# fbase : baseline availability (annual object loss rate) # f : annual disk failure raPo, aggressively esPmated as 0.1 [2] # r : replicaPon degree # v : declared data value ($/MB) # cdisk : disk price ($/MB), set to $100/2TB
IndemnificaPon Cost of extra copies
Sample Premiums: v = $10,000/MB
! Observations on p-v (premium/insured-value) ratio " Highest number matching shipping industry
# With baseline availability of 0.1 and one extra copy " Declines when growing r or fbase " Indemnification dominates
# With claimed value significantly larger than storage cost # Till replication degree and/or baseline availability large enough
